# Bifurcations of the perfect system

## First bifurcation equation

The sympy analysis delivers Eq. (@eq-20221221154153), which is reproduced below

$$\xi_n \, \xi_p \, E_{npk} + 2\lambda_n \, \xi_n \, \xi_p \, \dot{E}_{pk} = 0,$$

for all $\xi_1, \dots, \xi_m$. The above equation is first derived with respect to $\xi_i$

$$\xi_p \, E_{ipk} + \xi_n \, E_{nik} + 2\lambda_i \, \xi_p \, \dot{E}_{pk} + 2\lambda_n \, \xi_n \, \dot{E}_{ik} = 0,$$

then to $\xi_j$, delivering the following bifurcation equation

$$E_{ijk} + \lambda_i \, \dot{E}_{jk} + \lambda_j \, \dot{E}_{ik} = 0.$${#eq-20221221153708}
